questions.correctAnswer: They were completely indifferent to it.
options: They were completely indifferent to it.
They preferred the exotic over the everyday.
They showed no interest in it at all.
They focused exclusively on it, eschewing the exotic.
questions.question: According to the text, which of the following best describes the attitude of many Romantics towards the everyday social world around them?

questions.correctAnswer: The artist is a fiercely independent genius who creates original works of art.
options: The artist is a fiercely independent genius who creates original works of art.
The artist is a passive recipient of external influences.
The artist has no connection to the public.
The artist is a socially and politically disengaged individual.
questions.question: Which of the following best characterizes the Romantic concept of the artist as it was portrayed in the text?

questions.correctAnswer: a literary and artistic cultural movement that originated in europe during the late 18th and early 19th centuries, characterized by strong emotional expression, subjectivity, and a focus on individualism and imagination.
questions.question: Term: Romantic Movement

questions.correctAnswer: although often viewed as separate movements following romanticism, some critics argue that they represent the opposite tendencies that were reconciled within romanticism itself. while romanticism unified emotions and reason, symbolism and realism may have taken these opposites to extremes in their subsequent developments.
questions.question: Term: Romanticism vs. Realism

questions.correctAnswer: the spirit of rebellion or change that was a defining characteristic of the romantic movement, evident in its focus on social and political consciousness and its challenge to established norms.
questions.question: Term: Revolutionary energy

questions.correctAnswer: a contemporary literary theory that posits the separate work of literature as a dissolved sea of interconnected texts, derived from various cultural discourses and part of an archival network.
questions.question: Term: Intertextuality

questions.correctAnswer: in current literary theory, the conception of the artist as a fiercely independent genius who creates original works of art has been demoted to that of a collective "voice" influenced by various texts, language systems, conventions, and power structures. this notion was subverted in a dramatic, romantic fashion when radical manifestoes were delivered by linguistically powerful individuals, recapitulating the revolutionary spirit and events of the romantic movement itself.
questions.question: Term: Sovereign artist

questions.correctAnswer: De første tyske tropper trænger ind i Danmark

options: Der er et store nazistmøde i København, der slutter med slagsmål og arrestationer

questions.question: Hvilken af følgende begivenheder foregår den 17. november 1940?

questions.correctAnswer: politik der forsøgte at bevare danmarks demokratiske samfundsform under den tyske besættelse i 1940-erne.
questions.question: Term: Samarbejdspolitikken (Samarbejdspolitik)

questions.correctAnswer: det danske nazistparti, der blev ledet af frits clausen og havde til formål at overtage magten i danmark i kølvandet på tysklands fremgang.
questions.question: Term: DNSAP (Dansk Socialistisk Parti)

questions.correctAnswer: en række folkelige arrangementer, der samlede mange danskere for at synges patriotiske sange i protest mod den tyske besættelse.
questions.question: Term: Alsangsbevægelsen (Alsangsstævnerne)

questions.correctAnswer: den danske modstandsbevægelse var en gruppe af mennesker, der arbejdede for at fjerne den tyske besættelse fra danmark.
questions.question: Term: Modstandsbevægelsen (Modstand)

questions.correctAnswer: statue i københavn, der symboliserer en af de vigtigste kampagner under den danske modstandsbevægelse.
questions.question: Term: Den lille Hornblæser (Den lille hornblæser)

questions.correctAnswer: fællessangbevægelse der startede i ålborg i juli måned og kulminerede i fælledparken i københavn den 1. september 1940, hvor over 700.000 mennesker deltog
questions.question: Alsangsstævner

questions.correctAnswer: udenrigsminister fra den 8. juli 1940 og blev kritiseret for at føre en passiv politik mod besættelsesmagten, som han i sin tiltrædelseserklæring udtalte: "ved de store sejre, der har slået verden med forbavselse og beundring, er en ny tid oprundet i europa, der vil medføre en nyordning i politisk og økonomisk henseende under tysklands førerskab."
questions.question: Erik Scavenius

questions.correctAnswer: dansk national socialistiske arbejderparti (dnsap), danske nazister der havde håbet på at overtage regeringsmagten i danmark i kølvandet af den tyske fremgang
questions.question: DNSAP

questions.correctAnswer: en repræsentant for den såkaldte højgaard-kreds mødte privataudiens hos christian 10 den 14. november og foreslog kongen at udnævne en ny regering uden om folketinget og de politiske partier, kongen afviste forslaget
questions.question: Højgaard-kreds
